intro: Hibbertia acrotoma, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red veins. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in regions such as Western Australia and South Australia. Hibbertia acrotoma has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
